Job description

API Developer
Technology Data & Labs (TDL) aspires to create experiences our customers value, while providing best in class technology, advice and services to enable insights across Suncorp.

Suncorp’s Digital Marketplace is an Agile team that innovates, simplifies and delivers quality product and customer experiences for Suncorp group brands. We design and build unique innovative product solutions and technology platforms that deliver value for our customers.

As a Software Engineer your purpose is to apply your knowledge and experience of full stack development, scalable architecture, and DevOps practices and theories, applying current best practices and industry standards to develop the team and the platform.

You Will Be Responsible For
  • Implementing front-ends in Angular/React and other client-side MVC/MVVM libraries.
  • Using JavaScript to build cross native mobile application e.g. React Native
  • Working closely with and incorporate feedback from product management, interaction designers and backend engineers.
  • Being highly proficient problem solving.
  • Pro-actively improve client side performance.
  • Mentoring/coaching others in the team and domain.

Key Capabilities
  • Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology;
  • Understanding of the full web technology stack (e.g. HTTP, cookies, headers, asset loading/caching
  • Angular/React JS framework with data binding
  • Node.js and Javascript task runners (Grunt.js, Gulp.js)
  • Using and producing modular, scalable, testable HTMLS5/JS/CSS3 in a highly proficient way.
  • Proven deliveries in TDD.
  • Experience working with cloud based services (including SaaS, PaaS, IaaS) and good understanding of security challenges involved in deploying to the Cloud
  • Understanding of CICD and DevOps best practices and theories
  • Experience with the following…
    • AWS Cloud Services
    • RHEL/CentOS
    • Java, Python or similar
    • Maven, Gradle or similar
    • Jenkins or similar
    • Git
    • Rest

If you have the skills and abilities listed above and would like to know more about this great opportunity then please contact Jess Ryan from our recruitment team on jessica.ryan@suncorp.com.au

Wordpress Developer

Company Name BetEasy Company Location 120 Collins Street , Melbourne, VIC 3006, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 69 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

BetEasy is the most sophisticated and rewarding wagering operator in its class. Built on a powerful partnership with The Stars Group, we are well on our journey to be the number one wagering operator by 2020, delivered through excellent people, process and technology within an innovative and dynamic culture.

To help us on our journey we’ve got a newly created role for a WordPress Developer to be part of highly focused, mission-driven teams delivering a range of solutions using emerging technologies. We’re looking for a problem solver who can take complex initiatives and break them down into lean deliverable milestones whilst being able to articulate and provide clarification to non-technical colleagues.

More about the ROLE:
Reporting to the Development Practice Manager, you'll play a key role in the architecture of solutions delivered to the business, and will be involved throughout all stages of the software development process. Key focuses include:
  • WordPress – Developing, supporting & innovating custom WordPress sites including:
    • multi-site admin, setup and development
    • new features, plugins and functionality
  • Rapid Frontends – We’re in the process of breaking apart our website into CI/CD driven deployable components, owned & supported by the team who built them
  • Championing continuous improvements & knowledge sharing within your team & the wider practice
  • Contribution to the delivery process, tech enablement & architecture alignment of the team & practice
\xa0
About YOU:
We’re looking for a WordPress Developer who is looking for a long term career in Front-End engineering. Ideally you’ll have a degree in Multimedia/Computer Science or similar but it’s not overly important if you’ve done a better job figuring it all out yourself! If you’ve an active interest in the latest technologies and architectural trends then check out the details below and if they apply to you then please send us your application today!
  • 3 years’ experience building & supporting custom WordPress applications, including WP-engine
  • Experience developing WordPress custom functionality, plugins and modules
  • Experience working with PHP, JavaScript & HTML5/CSS3
  • Exposure to modern JavaScript frameworks, languages and tools such as NPM, Webpack etc
  • Highly proficient with responsive web development; cross-browser and device agnostic
  • An active interest in the latest technologies & architectural trends (meetups, blogs etc.)
  • An understanding of the value & challenges in implementing Continuous Integration/Delivery
  • A proven track record of delivering the best solution for the task at hand, not just building the solution expected/requested, and putting forward alternative solutions

If you’re passionate about designing elegant solutions that are at the bleeding edge then this is the role for you. In return for your hard work we have a number of benefits and initiatives to support you personally and professionally including but not limited to 5 weeks’ annual leave, Lunch ‘n’ Learn sessions, matched charity donations, the MYKI commuter club and, as the official wagering partner to the AFL, there are heaps of opportunities to catch a game or two!

Why BetEasy?

BetEasy has been recognised as an Employer of Choice by The Australian Business Awards for the 2nd year running! With teams in Darwin, Melbourne and Sydney, we’re passionate about what we do and proud of our unique heritage and entrepreneurial spirit. We work together to deliver exceptional outcomes that push the limits of our customers' expectations. With brilliant minds and a vibrant culture, the sky’s the limit! Our environment is supportive and friendly, we encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. If you thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment, come and join us on this incredible journey.

To find more about BetEasy please visit https://workatbeteasy.com.au/

Disclaimer: BetEasy does not accept unsolicited agency resumes.

[

Brewing Team Leader

Company Name Carlton & United Breweries Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 153 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About CUB

Carlton & United Breweries (CUB) is one of Australia’s most iconic companies. We locally brew some of Australia's most famous beers including Victoria Bitter, Carlton Draught, Pure Blonde, Great Northern, Matilda Bay and ciders including Strongbow, Mercury and Bulmers, as well as distribute some of the world’s leading international brands including Corona, Stella Artois and Budweiser.

Joining CUB, you are opening up a world of career possibilities. We are a part of AB InBev, the largest and only truly global brewer selling over 400 brands across 100 markets and employing 200,000 people. Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. We are committed to driving growth that leads to better living for more people in more places and focussed on bringing people and cultures together through our brands and experiences.

The Role

Reporting to the Brewing Manager and working on a rotating shift basis primarily you will be tasked with coaching the Operator teams to meet the production plans, achieve department KPI's and deliver site brewing performance targets. In addition to this you will build capability within the team through the structured implementation of VPO, AB InBev’s world class manufacturing program.

This is a great opportunity to join the CUB team and make your mark within the business. CUB offers a fantastic working environment, excellent career progression opportunities and benefits such as product allocation.

What We Look For

The ideal candidate for this role will be a proven people leader with a demonstrated ability to optimise production performance and processes. To be successful in this role you will
  • Ideally have a background from within the brewing or similar industry
  • Have had exposure to a high volume manufacturing environment such as food, FMCG, automotive or pharmaceuticals
  • Have a solid grounding in lean manufacturing and continuous improvement methodologies
  • Be tertiary qualified in Engineering or Science
  • Possess a passion for quality coupled with an energy to motivate your team to drive best practice
  • Have excellent communication skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships right across the business
  • Have a demonstrated understanding of OHS requirements and a safety first ethos


What We Offer

Learn on the job. Jump in at the deep-end. Dream big!

At CUB, our greatest strength is our people. We recruit people who can be better than ourselves and retain people by allowing them to grow at their own pace, providing training opportunities and offering a safe environment where they will be rewarded for their contributions. To learn more, visit CUB - Our 10 principles.

Join one of the world’s largest consumer packaged goods companies where opportunity awaits. Apply now!

Associate

  • Consumer Goods

Senior Software Engineer - C++

Company Name IRESS Company Location Level 16 385 Bourke Street Melbourne, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 89 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Role


We have multiple roles available as we continue to expand our teams in Melbourne. As a Senior C++ Software Engineer, you'll ensure the continuous innovation and development of IRESS Financial Market products. You’ll contribute throughout the entire development lifecycle from inception to deployment and production support. Our Melbourne Head Office is home to a number of products across Trading, Market Data and Portfolio Management. Our Financial Markets products process over 10K transactions per second with 2 million+ users globally.


  • Tech stack includes C++ 17, MFC, .Net, Python, SQL,
  • Tools include JIRA, Git, SonarQube, Artifactory, Visual Studio 2015, JIRA and TeamCity
  • You will build complex, high performance, multithreaded trading application with a global user base
  • Develop high-quality automation test scripts to improve test coverage and product quality
  • Be part of a collaborative team as we implement AGILE methods and improve our automated testing and continuous delivery pipelines
  • Review and analyse business requirements whilst enhancing our product offering
  • You'll gain exposure to modern development methods as we migrate to AWS and introduce DevOps practices
  • You’ll identify product and process weaknesses and possible refinements
  • Take a lead on projects whilst mentoring junior team members
  • You’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills learn from industry specialists
  • Be part of an environment that fosters innovation and welcomes new ideas
  • Keep up to date with technical trends, tools and methodologies, undertake research as required
  • Newly refurbished CBD office which includes collaborative working spaces, games area, meditation room and bring your kids to work days


With a new CTO who joined us last year, we have a strong vision to continually improve the way we build world-class products. You’ll help us in our goal to become the most desirable technology company in Financial Services during an exciting period of change. We’ve doubled in size in the last few years and they’ll be plenty of opportunities grow. This includes developing your technical and/or leadership skills or simply solving new problems in other teams.



About You


  • Experience in a similar role as Software Engineer, Developer, Programmer etc.
  • Comfortable with C++, n-tier architecture, multithreading and SQL.
  • Good design, development and collaboration skills gained in developing software product solutions
  • Effective communication skills both written and verbal
  • Creative mindset with an appetite to tackle complex problems


Culture


We recognize and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various socials throughout the year. We don't sweat the small stuff either, our dress code is as relaxed as we are. As well as local charity events and initiatives, we hold global days and activities to make the most of our global strength and diversity. This includes a yearly global hackathon! We may be one of the largest financial software providers, but we haven't forgotten our roots; we've kept the entrepreneurial spirit and agility that defined our early years - it's something we continue to look for and admire in our people.


Benefits


  • Flexible Working
  • Subsidized health insurance
  • 3 days leave per year to participate in charity initiatives
  • Access to various learning and development programs.
  • Up to 26 weeks paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers) and the ability to work part-time when returning to work.

Want to have a significant impact in one of Australia’s fastest growing technology companies? If so please apply – we look forward to hearing from you.


We are an equal opportunity employer and embrace diversity at IRESS. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

\xa0

English Language Teacher

Company Name Navitas Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 248 views

Job description

English Language Teacher

Melbourne, Short Fixed-Term Contracts

\xa0

Navitas is a diversified global education provider that offers an extensive range of educational services for students and professionals including university programs, language training, workforce education and student recruitment. Navitas listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX) in 2004 and is now an S&P/ASX Top 100 Company, employing more than 5,500 staff globally. Navitas operates across three Divisions.

Hawthorn-Melbourne is part of the Navitas Group. Hawthorn-Melbourne is one of Australia’s oldest and largest English language centres and maintains a reputation as one of the country’s premier English schools based on the quality of its teaching, curriculum, support services and facilities. Hawthorn-Melbourne, part of University Partnerships Australasia division within Navitas, is seeking to recruit English Language Teachers.



Essential Skills & Experience

\xa0


Qualifications

\xa0

  • Minimum of a first degree and formally recognized TESOL teaching qualifications



Experience


  • EFL/ESL teaching experience in Australia or overseas



Skills


  • Demonstration of excellent teaching abilities which produce high quality outcomes for Hawthorn-Melbourne students through the application of:
  • constructive and culturally sensitive class management;
  • current TESOL theory and practice in the ESL/EFL classroom; and
  • knowledge of the student profile including learning styles.
  • (Assessment of this criterion will include classroom visit(s) by the Director of Studies or Senior Teacher.)


  • Understanding of the importance of, and willingness and ability to carry out, the administrative duties required of Hawthorn-Melbourne teaching staff to a high standard (e.g. monitoring of attendance, assessment:standardisation and moderation, testing and placement, course record-keeping).


  • Existing or potential positive contribution to the life of Hawthorn-Melbourne through the utilisation of other skills and knowledge (e.g. other language skills, flexibility, innovative ideas and assistance with tasks outside of the classroom, such as graduation and professional development).


  • Professionalism, which includes qualities such as teamwork, collegiality, information and resource sharing, and high standards of professional conduct.



Desirable

  • EAP / IELTS preparation teaching experience
  • Secondary school teaching experience (particularly maths &/or science)
  • DELTA / Masters degree in TESOL or equivalent
  • e-learning skills
  • Strong MS Office competencies, including Outlook, Word and Power Point

\xa0

\xa0

What we offer

\xa0

The Navitas Group offers outstanding opportunities within Australia and abroad, and is values driven and an equal opportunity employer.


Successful applicants will be subject to relevant pre-employment checks, which may include a National Police Check and/or a Working with Children Check. Only people who are eligible to work in Australia may apply for this position.

\xa0

To be considered for this position you will be required to submit your CV and a covering email/letter. A Position Description Statement (PDS) is attached.

\xa0

Enquiries and applications, should be forwarded to:

\xa0

teaching@hawthornenglish.vic.edu.au

\xa0

Applications close: 31 October 2018

835026497:
[

Senior Management Consultant

Company Name Lloyd Connect Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 267 views

Job description

  • Are you an experienced Senior Management Consultant from the Big 4?
  • Do you want to work with a fun, innovative team in a creative environment?
  • Are you instrumental in leading the development & delivery of Innovative solutions?


Our client is an innovative Australian Owned Management Consultancy firm and we are seeking a Senior Management Consultant with ‘Big 4’ experience to join their growing team. This innovative firm specialises in learning and cultural transformation programs and uses creative and innovative techniques to deliver the best solutions to their clients’ needs, including tools such as apps, custom-built learning environments, bespoke films and even virtual reality!


You’ll be working with a group of talented, inspiring and professional individuals, where your experience, knowledge and contribution will be valued and heard! Reporting to the Managing Director you will have direct responsibility and accountability for your own work and will help clients to define learning and cultural needs and be instrumental in the development and delivery of innovative solutions. \xa0This role will Support businesses of every size, create cultural and behavioural change through creative experiences. Using innovative techniques, cutting-edge technology and organisational psychology, we partner with our clients to deliver solutions that sustain cultural change.


Key Responsibilities

  • Cultural assessment - ability to work on client side to investigate cultural issues and action for change.
  • Develop strategy - \xa0help clients strengthen their strategy-development processes. Assist clients with solutions to specific issues or design a whole new approach to strategic management and planning.
  • Stakeholder management - establish client expectations and effectively communicate those across the team.
  • Behavioural change management – work with organisations to define and implement organisational behavioural change management.
  • Project management - create structured schedules and project plans based on the project goals, resources needed, potential risks, time to market and budget constraints to run multiple small and large scale projects.
  • Project Execution and Governance - tracking deadlines, deliverables, resources, timelines and P&L for each individual project.
  • Business development & sales - engage in client development activities, establishing relationships and identifying cross selling opportunities, development and delivery of value driven executive presentation.
  • Talent development - helping clients identify, retain and develop talent.
  • Content oversight – oversee the design and delivery outputs including program materials, proposals, facilitators guides, presentations etc.\xa0
  • Facilitation - deliver masterful facilitation to create relevant and engaging learning experiences.\xa0


To be successful in this role you will have degree qualifications (MBA) and/or relevant practical experience in one of the following disciplines: facilitation, content design, adult learning theory, adult learning models, and learning technologies. As well as have a Project Management qualification with Agile or similar certification and Leadership coaching (MBTI accredited), Change Management qualification – PROCSI or Prince2 will be highly desirable.


You will also have B2B sales experience at C-suite level, expertise in Change Management and business-led transformational change programs, sound knowledge and experience in design and content development as well as have experience at a top-tier management consulting firm displaying progressive advancement and a strong record of achievement and experience leading transformational change projects including the responsibility for standalone deliverables, experience in managing all stages of the consulting cycle and the ability to build effective relationships, manage people, drive change and accomplish challenging goals.


David Lloyd
+61 418418823
david@lloydconnect.com.au
www.lloydconnect.com.au

\xa0

Job description


JOB ID: 180646
SALARY RANGE: $85,953 to $94,644 pa (plus 17% super)
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full-time (36.75 hours per week) and fixed term for 2 years
LOCATION: Geelong Waterfront Campus or Melbourne Burwood Campus

ABOUT THE ROLE

Deakin University has a well-deserved global reputation for pushing the limits of digital innovation. Our team is the powerhouse behind our ambitious digital strategy and roadmap, working across a range of emerging technologies, differentiating solutions, enterprise applications, platforms, integrations and user experience teams.

We are looking for talented, enthusiastic digital specialists to join our team to help progress our digital agenda. If you want to be part of an innovative and exciting team then we would like to hear from you.

This will include:

  • Undertaking the design, development, configuration and support of corporate applications and platforms.
  • Providing software solutions that meet business requirements, conform to best practice standards, are fully tested and are accurately documented for future reference.
  • Liaising effectively with business representatives, team members and vendors as necessary in order to deliver timely business outcomes.
  • Analysis of requirements and the provision of technical advice associated with business decisions regarding the provision of administrative computer systems.



ABOUT YOU

  • Tertiary Level Degree in computing related discipline.
  • Substantial Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and professional experience in a commercial organisation or other relevant environment.
  • Significant programming experience and expertise across a variety of applications and platforms, with a strong record of completed projects.
  • Understanding of complex and technical design, development, and support related issues with major applications.


For a full list of the selection criteria please see the position description

TO APPLY
